meanings.definition: The practice or occupation of creating or designing costumes.
meanings.sent1: She studied costumeries in school to learn how to make costumes.
meanings.sent2: The costumeries in the theater department were always busy during play rehearsals.
meanings.sent3: The costumeries at the local theater had a costume party to showcase their creations.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a treasure trove of imaginative costumeries waiting to come to life.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors and intricate designs of the costumeries left a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: A store or business that sells or rents costumes.
meanings.sent1: We visited the costumeries downtown to find the perfect outfit for the party.
meanings.sent2: The costumeries on Main Street had a wide selection of costumes for Halloween.
meanings.sent3: The costumeries had a sale, and everyone rushed to grab their favorite costumes.
meanings.sent4: The costumeries transformed into a magical wonderland during the holiday season.
meanings.sent5: Walking into the costumeries felt like stepping into a different era with all the historical costumes.

meanings.definition: The collection or range of costumes available for use or purchase.
meanings.sent1: The costumeries at the party had a variety of costumes for guests to choose from.
meanings.sent2: The school play had a budget to expand their costumeries for future productions.
meanings.sent3: The costumeries for the school play were so popular that they ran out of costumes.
meanings.sent4: Her closet was a treasure trove of costumeries collected over the years.
meanings.sent5: The costumeries at the convention showcased the creativity and diversity of costume designs.
